text: The Seehorn (2,439 m) is a mountain of the Swiss Pennine Alps, overlooking Gondo in the canton of Valais. Unlike most other mountains in Valais, the Seehorn lies on the south side of the Alps, in the southern Simplon Valley. From the Furggu pass (1,872 m) a trail leads to its summit. ==References== ==External links== * Seehorn on Hikr Category:Mountains of the Alps Category:Mountains of Switzerland Category:Mountains of Valais Category:Two- thousanders of Switzerland
title: Seehorn
